title: Monolite68
author: Monolite68
created_time: December 22, 2022, 10:41:47 AMLast edit: December 26, 2022, 10:05:50 AM by Monolite68
content: Hi to everybody.I bought a Radeon RX Vega 64 8 GB and yesterday I tried to install on mining rig. I must point out that until yesterday 3 RX 580 Sapphire Nitro and 1 Nvidia 1660 TI cards were installed. I removed all the cards and tried to install the VEGA 64, but the system does not see it.Motherboard is B250 Mining Board BTC 12GPU Where I was wrong? What do I have to do to make the system to see the card?Thanks a lot

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Monolite68 on December 22, 2022, 10:41:47 AMHi to everybody.I bought a Radeon RX Vega 64 8 GB and yesterday I tried to install on mining rig. I must point out that until yesterday 3 RX 580 Sapphire Nitro and 1 Nvidia 1660 TI cards were installed. I removed all the cards and tried to install the VEGA 64, but the system does not see it.Motherboard is B250 Mining Board BTC 12GPU Where I was wrong? What do I have to do to make the system to see the card?Thanks a lotCheck in another working PC that you might have,if it works there normally it should also work in the B250 which for me personally is one of the best mining motherboards out there.Where did you bought the card?I don't think you bought it new as they are rare to find as new nowadays so most likely you bought it used,so as I said you should check in another PC you have available and if it works there then it is time to troubleshoot the issue in B250 board but you should try it in another PC as that is the first thing to do in such case.If it works in the other PC,try to put first the card in the x16 slot and then try a 010S version riser.

comments.author: UniJo
comments.body: If you use risers. Did you try to swap them? I had several cases where the riser died when it was turned off after days/months of duty.

comments.author: Monolite68
comments.body: Quote from: UniJo on December 22, 2022, 02:08:28 PMIf you use risers. Did you try to swap them? I had several cases where the riser died when it was turned off after days/months of duty.Yes I use them, and I will try to swap 'em

comments.author: Monolite68
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on December 22, 2022, 01:40:28 PMQuote from: Monolite68 on December 22, 2022, 10:41:47 AMHi to everybody.I bought a Radeon RX Vega 64 8 GB and yesterday I tried to install on mining rig. I must point out that until yesterday 3 RX 580 Sapphire Nitro and 1 Nvidia 1660 TI cards were installed. I removed all the cards and tried to install the VEGA 64, but the system does not see it.Motherboard is B250 Mining Board BTC 12GPU Where I was wrong? What do I have to do to make the system to see the card?Thanks a lotCheck in another working PC that you might have,if it works there normally it should also work in the B250 which for me personally is one of the best mining motherboards out there.Where did you bought the card?I don't think you bought it new as they are rare to find as new nowadays so most likely you bought it used,so as I said you should check in another PC you have available and if it works there then it is time to troubleshoot the issue in B250 board but you should try it in another PC as that is the first thing to do in such case.If it works in the other PC,try to put first the card in the x16 slot and then try a 010S version riser.The motherboard isn't a new one, but it works fine with 4 RX 580. Other PC, just like B250, haven't got any PCIe x16 slot, so I have to use riser. My risers aren't 010S version, but why do you advise this version?Should I change any setting on motherboard BIOS?thanks a lot

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Monolite68 on December 22, 2022, 03:21:09 PMQuote from: swogerino on December 22, 2022, 01:40:28 PMQuote from: Monolite68 on December 22, 2022, 10:41:47 AMHi to everybody.I bought a Radeon RX Vega 64 8 GB and yesterday I tried to install on mining rig. I must point out that until yesterday 3 RX 580 Sapphire Nitro and 1 Nvidia 1660 TI cards were installed. I removed all the cards and tried to install the VEGA 64, but the system does not see it.Motherboard is B250 Mining Board BTC 12GPU Where I was wrong? What do I have to do to make the system to see the card?Thanks a lotCheck in another working PC that you might have,if it works there normally it should also work in the B250 which for me personally is one of the best mining motherboards out there.Where did you bought the card?I don't think you bought it new as they are rare to find as new nowadays so most likely you bought it used,so as I said you should check in another PC you have available and if it works there then it is time to troubleshoot the issue in B250 board but you should try it in another PC as that is the first thing to do in such case.If it works in the other PC,try to put first the card in the x16 slot and then try a 010S version riser.The motherboard isn't a new one, but it works fine with 4 RX 580. Other PC, just like B250, haven't got any PCIe x16 slot, so I have to use riser. My risers aren't 010S version, but why do you advise this version?Should I change any setting on motherboard BIOS?thanks a lotYou must have a separate computer to test video cards. You don't need a PC but a motherboard, processor, memory and power supply, + any 64 GB SSD. You can buy it very cheap on AM3 socket architecture.If I buy a used video card, then I disassemble it, change the thermal paste and thermal pads as necessary, clean it from dust, test it and then install it in the mining farm.Even if you bought a video card with verification, it may be damaged during transportation.

comments.author: batsonxl
comments.body: 1st check the card on pcie 16x without riseir.if you still dont see your card then there is problem with card

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: I called rx vega 56 and 64 pain in the ass graphic cards  , I used to own a complete 6 rigs with 56 and 64 RX vega and I saw hell managing them, they frequently give me problem, one minute it's all detected and later two gpu will be missing in Hive OS.Connect the GPU directly to x16 slot without the riser, let's see what happens doing this first.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on December 24, 2022, 05:56:21 PMI called rx vega 56 and 64 pain in the ass graphic cards  , I used to own a complete 6 rigs with 56 and 64 RX vega and I saw hell managing them, they frequently give me problem, one minute it's all detected and later two gpu will be missing in Hive OS.Connect the GPU directly to x16 slot without the riser, let's see what happens doing this first. Video cards 56 and 64 RX vega have difficulties with overclocking settings and usually the vega 56 video card was flashed with bios from vega 64 to get a larger hashrate, but there were no big problems with these video cards. You won't get that experience with Nvidia

comments.author: Monolite68
comments.body: Thanks a lot to everybodyYour advices were really useful for me to solve problem and to understand what can I do with this kind of graphic cardThanks again

comments.author: batsonxl
comments.body: Quote from: Monolite68 on December 26, 2022, 10:04:26 AMThanks a lot to everybodyYour advices were really useful for me to solve problem and to understand what can I do with this kind of graphic cardThanks againIt will be helpful for other people if you share your solution.

comments.author: Monolite68
comments.body: per quanto riguarda il problema che avevo rilevato nel primo post, la soluzione è stata alimentare adeguatamente la scheda, e quindi collegando 2 cavi da 8 pin nei rispettivi alloggiamenti alimentandoli con un alimentatore di potenza adeguataGrazie a tutti di nuovo

comments.author: fmz89
comments.body: Quote from: Monolite68 on December 22, 2022, 10:41:47 AMHi to everybody.I bought a Radeon RX Vega 64 8 GB and yesterday I tried to install on mining rig. I must point out that until yesterday 3 RX 580 Sapphire Nitro and 1 Nvidia 1660 TI cards were installed. I removed all the cards and tried to install the VEGA 64, but the system does not see it.Motherboard is B250 Mining Board BTC 12GPU Where I was wrong? What do I have to do to make the system to see the card?Thanks a lotVega 64 has been 5 years coming, assuming you bought reference card and if that card in shelf for 3months+, it might be fungus run down the pcb, but dont worry its happen in gpu mining specially old gpus, just clean up with detergent for half hours after that wash with alcohol, dry up under sun or something hot for 6hrs, put it back again, if still not working use hotgun 260c for about 50s each component. Most likely it will run again, goodluck
